page.title: 09Cliff Path Walk
page.content: This is part of the continuous path along the North coast of Jersey. Being some two & a half miles long it has some glorious views and many interesting features. From the rifle range the path divides into two, one being a bridle path. Soon Ile Agois comes into sight, an island with a past history of religious settlement shown from excavations and the coins that have been found. The cliff here is more than 200ft high and is a difficult but possible climb down to the island following a stream. The path undulates on to the Devil's Hole, a popular inn and refreshment stop.
